title: ‘Stroke means I’m too slow to make connecting flights. Virgin Atlantic is charging £6k to switch planes’
text:
Has a company treated you unfairly? Our consumer champion, Katie Morley, is here to help. For how to contact her click here.

Dear Katie,

My wife and I have spent our winters in Florida for the past 13 years and we usually fly with Virgin Atlantic. We fly from Manchester to Tampa, but this year our outbound flight from Tampa was booked to go via JFK, with a 1 hr 8 min wait at the airport.

I asked if this would be enough time and the agent assured me the terminals we needed were next to each other and connection would not be a problem. I accepted this and paid £5,156 for the flights. Unfortunately around a month after booking the flights I suffered a stroke.

I have made a good recovery but...
description: Has a company treated you unfairly?
